properties.event summary: 10/08/2011: On Saturday morning, in the neighborhood of San German in Miguel Aleman, Tamaulipas, Mexico, 11 people were killed during the attack on federal forces. According to witnesses and residents the shootouts, which started in the early morning, left houses and vehicles damaged. The shootouts began between rival organized crime groups and then Army and Navy personnel joined the shootouts. No group claimed responsibility for this incident, but the Gulf Cartel is believed to be responsible.
properties.event title: Eleven People were Killed During a Shootout between Federal Forces and Organized Crime Groups
properties.location: The shootouts occurred in  the neighborhood of San German in Miguel Aleman, Tamaulipas, Mexico.

properties.event summary: 10/10/2011: On Monday in Miguel Aleman, Tamaulipas, Mexico, alleged members of the Gulf Cartel attacked Navy personnel. Ten suspected Cartel members were killed in the clash and 22 were detained. No group claimed responsibility but the Gulf Cartel was suspected.
properties.event title: Navy Personnel Attacked by Alleged Gulf Cartel Members
properties.location: The attack occurred in Miguel Aleman, Tamaulipas, Mexico.

properties.event summary: 10/11/2011: On Tuesday in Reynosa, Tamaulipas, Mexico, the financial operator for the Gulf Cartel, Cesar Davila Garcia, aka El Gama, was murdered in a house on Colinas de Sol Street. No group claimed responsibility.
properties.location: The murder occurred in a house on Colinas del Sol Street in Reynosa.

properties.event summary: 11/15/2011: On Tuesday, in Tamaulipas, Mexico, on a train out of the Santa Rosa Plan de Ayala station, 24 year old passenger Nicaraguan Edgar Saldivar was beaten for not paying the $200 fine charged by drug dealers for passing through their territory. The passenger survived the attack. No group claimed responsibility but the Los Zetas were suspected.
properties.event title: Man Beaten on Train in Tamaulipas, Mexico
properties.location: The incident occurred on a train out of the Santa Rosa Plan de Ayala in Tamaulipas, Mexico.

properties.event summary: 10/25/2011: On Tuesday in the village of Control, Matamoros, Tamaulipas, Mexico, and Valle Hermoso, Tamaulipas, Mexico, battles broke out between organized crime gropus, blocking access to the international bridge Tratado de Libre Comercio and the Reynosa highway. The battle continued until the morning of 10/26/2011. The total amount of shootings was unknown. Many businesses did not open and parents did not send their children to school. The fighting took place because of the after the arrest of Rafael Cardenas-Vela alias "El Junior." Casualties were unknown. It is believed that the situation was orchestrated by rival members of the Gulf Cartel to prevent rival gangs from entering and confronting the group, but no specific group claimed responsibility.
properties.event title: Battles Rage Between Organized Crime Groups in Matamoros, Tamaulipas
properties.location: The fighting occurred in the village of Control, Matamoros, Tamaulipas, Mexico.
